Of Cruise, the director continued: “As a kid, I didn’t fit in and a lot of my life was imaginative play. I look forward to making a bunch of other kind of movies with you, I can’t wait.”

Cruise and Paramount are surely hoping “The Final Reckoning” follows in the footsteps of “Top Gun: Maverick,” which dazzled Cannes in 2022 and earned a five-minute standing ovation on its way $1.46 billion at the worldwide box office that summer. The film is directed by Christopher McQuarrie, who helmed three previous “Mission: Impossible” movies. But one can never doubt Cruise’s ability to deliver a blockbuster. Tom Cruise said goodbye to the “Mission: Impossible” franchise in electrifying fashion at the Cannes Film Festival, where “Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning” earned a five-minute ovation thanks in part to Cruise’s commitment to putting breathless and death-defying practical stunts on the big screen. I got to grow up and have my very own action figure.”

McQuarrie then passed the mic to Cruise. In addition to Cruise, “The Final Reckoning” brings back franchise stalwarts like Simon Pegg and Ving Rhames.
